definition: to refuse to accept as true or accurate : disbelieve
to cause disbelief in the accuracy or authority of
examples: trying to discredit the claims of a rival

definition: to deprive of good repute : disgrace
examples: personal attacks meant to discredit his opponent

definition: loss of credit (see credit entry 1 sense 3) or reputation
examples: I knew stories to the discredit of England

definition: lack or loss of belief or confidence : doubt
examples: contradictions cast discredit on his testimony
